movesets.name: Pivot

items.name: Eviolite
items.description: Boosts Defense and Special Defense of holder by 50% if it is an NFE Pokemon.

movesets.description:
Moves

This set makes full use of Foongus's brilliant supportive movepool and ability to pivot. Foongus is one of the few Pokemon with access to the coveted Spore, which allows it to consistently put one enemy, provided that it isn't a Grass-type, to sleep. From there, STAB attacks are a good idea so Foongus isn't completely helpless. Giga Drain acts as Foongus's primary STAB move and helps extend Foongus's longevity, and Sludge Bomb has more base power and allows Foongus to hit Snubbull, Snover, and opposing Foongus harder. Clear Smog is an alternative to Sludge Bomb for dissuading opponents from using stat boosting moves against Foongus, and has the bonus of going through Taunt. As a coverage option, Hidden Power Fighting can be used to damage Steel-types such as Pawniard, Ferroseed, and Magnemite, but Stun Spore is also a good choice as a secondary status move to paralyze sleep absorbers, Pokemon with innate sleep immunities, and faster Pokemon once Sleep Clause has been activated.

Set Details

The given EVs allow Foongus to reach 25 HP / 21 Def / 21 SpD after Eviolite, making Foongus very difficult to OHKO, with the Eviolite being necessary to give Foongus reasonable bulk. Regenerator is the vastly preferred ability because it allows Foongus to pivot effectively by healing when it switches out.

Usage Tips

Defensive Foongus is able to wall Chinchou and Fighting-types that lack Ice- or Psychic-type moves. Thanks to Regenerator, it doesn't mind repeatedly switching out of unfavorable match-ups. Foongus should always try to use Spore on something that is relevant and will be severely crippled by sleep, because Sleep Clause will only allow one Pokemon to be put to sleep at a time. Stun Spore should also be used cautiously as the paralyzed Pokemon will be unable to be hit by possibly more detrimental statuses. Paralyzing Timburr is usually not a good idea because Guts will allow it to muscle through Foongus with boosted attacks. As so much of Foongus's use revolves around its status moves, taking out the opposing cleric will make Foongus significantly more potent.

Team Options

Foongus fits into Fire / Water / Grass cores well because it takes advantage of Regenerator by switching. Slowpoke in particular handles Foongus's Fire-, Ice-, and Psychic-type weaknesses while Foongus is able to deal with Slowpoke's Grass- and Electric-type weaknesses, with a combination of the two completely shutting down Fighting-types. Both have Regenerator so they can switch back and forth easily, and Slowpoke greatly appreciates the removal of Toxic Spikes. Fighting-types can take out the Steel-types that wall Foongus, with Mienfoo in particular also possessing Regenerator for even more switching fun, although this will leave the team with a weakness to Flying-type moves. A combination of Foongus, Slowpoke, and Mienfoo creates a Regenerator core with numerous resistances that is remarkably difficult to break. A Steel-type on Foongus's own team, such as Pawniard, can cover Foongus's weaknesses to Flying-, Psychic-, and Ice-type moves. However, this leaves the team more susceptible to Fire-type attacks.

Tirtouga and Archen are two defensive Rock-types that have great type synergy with Foongus, absorbing Flying- and Fire-type attacks aimed at Foongus, while in return Foongus can easily withstand the Fighting-, Electric-, Water-, and Grass-type attacks that plague these Pokemon. With its numerous status moves, Foongus makes a great partner for sweepers looking for a chance to set up, and as it tends to force a lot of switches, a Rock- or Steel-type with Stealth Rock can take advantage of that.

moves.name: Absorb
moves.description: Leeches 50% damage.

moves.name: After You
moves.description: The target will attack immediately after the user in the same turn.

moves.name: Astonish
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Bide
moves.description: Charges for 2-3 turns; returns double the damage received in those turns.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Clear Smog
moves.description: Eliminates the target's stat changes.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Defense Curl
moves.description: Boosts Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Energy Ball
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Feint Attack
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Flash
moves.description: Lowers foe's accuracy 1 stage.

moves.name: Foul Play
moves.description: Uses the target's Attack stat in damage calculation.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Gastro Acid
moves.description: Nullifies the foe's ability.

moves.name: Giga Drain
moves.description: Leeches 50% damage.

moves.name: Grass Knot
moves.description: Deals damage based on the foe's weight.

moves.name: Growth
moves.description: Boosts Attack and Special Attack by one stage. Boosts Attack and Special Attack by two stages in bright sunlight.

moves.name: Hidden Power Bug
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Water
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Ingrain
moves.description: Heals the user 1/16 its max HP each turn. Prevents the user from switching.

moves.name: Mega Drain
moves.description: Leeches 50% of the damage dealt.

moves.name: Nature Power
moves.description: Attack changes based on terrain.

moves.name: Payback
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe has taken its turn.

moves.name: Poison Powder
moves.description: Poisons the target.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Rage Powder
moves.description: All moves target the user.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Rollout
moves.description: Doubles in power with each hit. Repeats for 5 turns.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Seed Bomb
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Sludge Bomb
moves.description: 30% chance to poison.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Solar Beam
moves.description: Charges up turn 1; attacks on turn 2.

moves.name: Spore
moves.description: Puts the target to sleep.

moves.name: Stun Spore
moves.description: Paralyzes the target.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Sweet Scent
moves.description: Lowers evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Synthesis
moves.description: Heals variably depending on the weather.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Venoshock
moves.description: Hits poisoned targets with double Base Power.

moves.name: Worry Seed
moves.description: Changes the foe's ability to Insomnia.

abilities.name: Effect Spore
abilities.description: Induces paralysis, poison, or sleep on contact.

abilities.name: Regenerator
abilities.description: Wielder heals 1/3 of its maximum HP on switching out.
